comments:
Description: Attached report can't be opened in RCP build.

Steps to reproduce:
1. In RCP build, Select File>Open report.
2. Select the attached report and open it. Exception is thrown out.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: The extension with ID 'org.eclipse.birt.report.data.oda.flatfile' is not found!

The BIRT ODA flatfile plugin is a special case, somewhat independent of the functionality of DtpManifestExplorer.  The BIRT DtpManifestExplorer supports any ODA plugin that implements either the "org.eclipse.datatools.connectivity.oda.datasource" or "org.eclipse.birt.data.oda.datasource" extension point.

In this case, the "org.eclipse.birt.report.data.oda.flatfile" plugin no longer directly implements any ODA extension point, starting in BIRT 2.0 M3 (see its plugin.xml).  It simply extends the "org.eclipse.datatools.connectivity.oda.flatfile" implementation to avoid having 2 duplicated oda.flatfile plugins.  Therefore, DtpManifestExplorer does not recognize the BIRT oda.flatfile as a valid ODA plugin.
BTW, this issue is not specific to RCP build.

The report design used here was apparently created prior to M3.  A new report design using the ODA flatfile data source would have referenced the DTP ODA flatfile plugin instead.
For example,
<oda-data-source extensionID="org.eclipse.datatools.connectivity.oda.flatfile" ...  >
</oda-data-source>

<oda-data-set extensionID="org.eclipse.datatools.connectivity.oda.flatfile.dataSet" ...>
</oda-data-set>

To open the older report design, one can manually update the design file to reference the DTP oda extensions instead.

Since the ODA flatfile is considered an exemplary ODA driver only, we do not currently support auto migration of an older report design to use the DTP oda.flatfile plugin.
If the community sees that such auto migration is important, we can add that.  I suspose I can add hard-coded checking in BIRT DtpManifestExplorer to look for the DTP oda.flatfile instead, but that might not be sufficient.  
A report design's oda data source/data set references should be automatically migrated from BIRT oda.flatfile to DTP oda.flatfile.  That is, it might be more straight-forward for the Model code to automatically update and save such changes in a report design.
Rick, comments?

Except birt.data.oda and datatools.connectivity.oda, BIRT ODA plugins are transparent to model. That is, "org.eclipse.birt.report.data.oda.flatfile" and "org.eclipse.datatools.connectivity.oda.flatfile" etc. never appear in the model source codes. If we do the auto-migration in the model package, above strings have to be hard-coded in the ODAManifestUtil. And this internally let the model source codes rely on Oda DataSource/DataSet plugin names. It might not be so good. Linda, any comment?

Rick,

I agree that it is not ideal to have to hard-code the special case for the automatic migration of oda.flatfile references in a report design file.

I'm not sure we do need to provide such migration, since the oda.flatfile driver is intended as an example only.  Want to hear from Wei whether the manual update solution is acceptable.  And we can re-open the bug if we hear from the open source community that it wants such auto migration.

BTW, I did try to have the BIRT DtpManifestExplorer return the DTP oda.flatfile manifest instead.  Though it allows the old report design to get loaded, but as expected, it then has other Model error since no match is found for "org.eclipse.birt.report.data.oda.flatfile.dataSet".
So if auto migration is indeed needed, it seems that the most straight-forward solution would be to hard-code Model's ODAManifestUtil, as discussed earlier.

OK, after discussion with Linda, we close this bug at this time. If the auto-migration feature is required, we reopen this bug.

BTW, "org.eclipse.birt.report.data.oda.flatfile.dataSet" is a part of flatfile plugin. Model throws this exception since DtpManifest cannot found this extension id. Please see getDataSetExtension() method in ODAManifestUtil for details. It is the same reason as "org.eclipse.birt.report.data.oda.flatfile". 

"org.eclipse.birt.report.data.oda.flatfile" is Oda flatfile DataSource. And "org.eclipse.birt.report.data.oda.flatfile.dataSet" is Oda flatfile DataSet.
*** Bug 126151 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

traces.message: The extension with ID 'org.eclipse.birt.report.data.oda.flatfile' is not found!
